alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 2:08AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Kingfisher, Garvin, southeastern Grady, northeastern Stephens, southwestern Lincoln, Oklahoma, Cleveland, southern Logan, northeastern Canadian, Pottawatomie and McClain Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 208 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles east of Okarche to near Norman to 4 miles northeast of Bray. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, Guthrie, Newcastle, Tecumseh, Pauls Valley, Purcell, Kingfisher, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village and Noble. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 65 and 158. Interstate 40 between mile markers 136 and 189. Interstate 44 between mile markers 107 and 157. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Canadian; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Stephens
